title: Backend: Implement core transformation engine with Jint
description: The system's .NET backend shall provide a transformation engine to manipulate intermediate JSON data using JavaScript (ECMAScript 2015/ES6) executed via the Jint library.
sprint_goal: Establish the secure, sandboxed transformation engine backend and the foundational API for script CRUD operations.
acceptance_criteria: The engine correctly executes a valid ES6 script that performs basic JSON object manipulation (add, remove, modify properties). The engine can be instantiated and invoked from the .NET backend code.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Integration tests passing for basic script execution.
deployment_notes: Core component for the entire feature.
business_value: Provides the fundamental data manipulation capability.

title: Backend: Secure Jint engine with a configurable sandbox
description: The Jint transformation engine must be executed within a secure sandbox environment with configurable constraints for execution timeout, memory allocation, statement count, and must have Common Language Runtime (CLR) access disabled.
sprint_goal: Establish the secure, sandboxed transformation engine backend and the foundational API for script CRUD operations.
acceptance_criteria: A script attempting to execute longer than the configured timeout is terminated. A script attempting to access .NET CLR objects throws a security exception. All constraint values can be modified via configuration.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing for each constraint violation.
deployment_notes: Critical for system stability and security.
business_value: Prevents malicious or poorly written scripts from impacting the system.

title: Backend: Implement CRUD API for transformation scripts
description: The system shall provide full CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) functionality for transformation scripts and allow a single script to be associated with multiple report configurations.
sprint_goal: Establish the secure, sandboxed transformation engine backend and the foundational API for script CRUD operations.
acceptance_criteria: An administrator can create, view, modify, and delete a transformation script via API endpoints.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Integration tests passing for all CRUD operations.
collaboration_required: Frontend team for API contract definition.
deployment_notes: Provides the API foundation for the management UI.
business_value: Enables management of reusable transformation logic.

title: Backend: Implement RBAC and Auditing for Script CRUD
description: Access to script CRUD operations and report associations shall be restricted via Role-Based Access Control (RBAC), and all such operations must be logged in an immutable audit trail.
sprint_goal: Establish the secure, sandboxed transformation engine backend and the foundational API for script CRUD operations.
acceptance_criteria: A user without the 'Administrator' role receives a 'Forbidden' error when attempting to access script management APIs. Creating, updating, or deleting a script creates an entry in the audit trail.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Integration tests passing for both authorized and unauthorized access attempts.
deployment_notes: Key security control for the feature.
business_value: Ensures only authorized users can modify server-side logic and maintains an audit history.

title: Backend: Implement At-Rest Encryption for Scripts
description: All transformation scripts must be stored encrypted at rest in the system's database.
sprint_goal: Establish the secure, sandboxed transformation engine backend and the foundational API for script CRUD operations.
acceptance_criteria: Direct inspection of the database table containing scripts shows that the script content is not in plaintext. The application can successfully decrypt and execute a script.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Integration test confirms data is encrypted at rest and can be decrypted for use.
deployment_notes: Requires careful management of encryption keys in production.
business_value: Protects intellectual property and sensitive logic stored in scripts.

title: Frontend: Implement Script Management UI with Monaco Editor
description: The Control Panel shall provide a UI for managing transformation scripts that embeds the Monaco Editor component to offer real-time JavaScript syntax highlighting, code completion, and validation.
sprint_goal: Develop the user-facing script editor and the critical preview functionality.
acceptance_criteria: The script management page displays an instance of the Monaco Editor. As a user types JavaScript code, syntax is highlighted correctly. A clear visual indicator appears under a JavaScript syntax error in real-time.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Component tests passing; E2E test validates editor loading and basic syntax highlighting.
deployment_notes: Monaco editor can be complex to integrate with build tools.
business_value: Provides a rich, developer-friendly experience for writing scripts.

title: Frontend: Build Three-Pane Resizable Editor Layout
description: The script editor UI shall be composed of three resizable panes for the script editor, sample JSON input, and transformed JSON output/error view.
sprint_goal: Develop the user-facing script editor and the critical preview functionality.
acceptance_criteria: The UI displays three distinct panes for script, input, and output. The user can drag the dividers between the panes to resize them.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Component tests passing.
business_value: Improves usability of the script development and testing workflow.

title: Backend: Implement /preview API Endpoint
description: The system shall expose a RESTful endpoint `POST /api/v1/transformations/preview` that adheres to the specified request body structure and HTTP response code behavior.
sprint_goal: Develop the user-facing script editor and the critical preview functionality.
acceptance_criteria: A POST request to `/api/v1/transformations/preview` with a valid script and sample data returns a 200 OK. A request with a JavaScript syntax error returns a 400 Bad Request.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Integration tests passing for all specified HTTP status code behaviors.
business_value: Enables the interactive script preview feature.

title: Backend: Implement Script Preview Logic
description: The system shall provide a preview function for administrators to test transformation scripts using either user-provided sample JSON or a limited sample of live data from a selected connector.
sprint_goal: Develop the user-facing script editor and the critical preview functionality.
acceptance_criteria: Executing a preview with provided sample JSON returns correctly transformed data. Executing a preview with a selected connector fetches data and returns transformed data. The number of records for live preview does not exceed the limit.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Integration tests passing for both sample data and live data previews.
business_value: Provides a rapid feedback loop for script development.

title: Backend: Add Timeout to Preview API Endpoint
description: The transformation preview API endpoint shall enforce a configurable, server-side execution timeout (default 30 seconds) using a CancellationToken, and all timeout events must be logged.
sprint_goal: Develop the user-facing script editor and the critical preview functionality.
acceptance_criteria: An API call with a script running longer than the configured timeout is terminated and returns a timeout error. Timeout events are logged.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Integration test with an infinite-loop script validates timeout behavior.
business_value: Protects the server from long-running preview scripts.

title: Backend: Implement Structured Error Handling for Script Exceptions
description: The transformation engine shall catch exceptions from user scripts, log the full error details, and return a structured error object in the API response.
sprint_goal: Develop the user-facing script editor and the critical preview functionality.
acceptance_criteria: When a script throws an exception, the engine catches it and does not crash. The API response body contains a JSON object with the structure `{"error": {"message": "...", "stackTrace": "...", "lineNumber": ...}}`.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Integration tests validate the structured error response for various script errors.
business_value: Provides actionable feedback to users for debugging their scripts.

title: Backend & Frontend: Implement Script Versioning
description: The system shall support versioning for transformation scripts, allowing administrators to view change history, compare versions with a visual diff, and revert to a previous version.
sprint_goal: Implement advanced features like versioning, data handling limits, and UI warnings.
acceptance_criteria: Every time a script is saved, a new version is created. The UI provides an interface to view historical versions. The UI allows selecting two versions and displays a visual 'diff'. The UI provides a 'revert' function.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Backend integration tests for versioning API passing; E2E tests for revert workflow passing.
business_value: Provides an audit trail and a safety net for script development.

title: Backend: Buffer Report Dataset as JsonNode
description: For reports utilizing a transformation script, the system shall buffer the entire dataset into memory as a System.Text.Json.JsonNode object before passing it to the transformation engine.
sprint_goal: Implement advanced features like versioning, data handling limits, and UI warnings.
acceptance_criteria: Data fetched from a connector is successfully parsed into a JsonNode object in memory. The JsonNode object is correctly passed as input to the Jint engine for transformation.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests validate parsing and passing of JsonNode to the engine.
deployment_notes: Key for performance to avoid full deserialization.
business_value: Improves performance by reducing memory allocation and parsing overhead.

title: Backend: Enforce Maximum Dataset Size for Transformation
description: The system shall enforce a configurable maximum dataset size for in-memory transformation, with a default limit of 256MB, to prevent OutOfMemory exceptions.
sprint_goal: Implement advanced features like versioning, data handling limits, and UI warnings.
acceptance_criteria: A report job attempting to process a dataset larger than the configured limit is marked as 'Failed'. The error message clearly indicates the size limit was exceeded.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Integration test verifies that a large dataset fails the job with the correct error.
business_value: Prevents system instability caused by excessively large datasets.

title: Frontend: Display Persistent Performance Warning
description: The Control Panel UI shall display a persistent performance warning to the administrator when a transformation script is associated with a report configuration, including a link to best-practice documentation.
sprint_goal: Implement advanced features like versioning, data handling limits, and UI warnings.
acceptance_criteria: When a user selects a transformation script in the report configuration UI, a warning message is displayed. The warning remains visible as long as a script is associated with the report.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Component test validates the conditional rendering of the warning.
business_value: Proactively informs users about potential performance implications.

title: Backend: Implement JSON Schema Validation for Script Output
description: The system shall validate the output of a transformation script against an associated JSON Schema, if present, and fail the job upon validation failure.
sprint_goal: Implement advanced features like versioning, data handling limits, and UI warnings.
acceptance_criteria: If a schema is associated and the script output is invalid, the job is marked as 'Failed'. The job log contains a descriptive error message detailing why the validation failed.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Integration tests validate both successful and failed schema validations.
business_value: Ensures data quality and contract adherence for transformed data.

title: Backend: Log Sandbox Constraint Violations to Audit Trail
description: The system shall log any attempt to violate the secure sandbox constraints to a security audit trail, including the script identifier and the specific constraint that was violated.
sprint_goal: Implement production-readiness features: auditing, monitoring, and reliability.
acceptance_criteria: When a script timeout occurs, a log entry is created in the security audit trail specifying the script ID and 'Timeout Violation'.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Integration tests verify that each type of sandbox violation creates a corresponding audit log entry.
business_value: Provides a forensic trail for investigating potential security incidents or abuse.

title: Backend: Ensure Audit Trail Compliance (SOC 2/ISO 27001)
description: The security audit trail for script management and execution must be designed for compliance with SOC 2 and ISO 27001 objectives, ensuring log integrity, immutability, and a minimum retention of one year.
sprint_goal: Implement production-readiness features: auditing, monitoring, and reliability.
acceptance_criteria: The audit trail cannot be modified or deleted through the application interface. The system's data retention policy is configured to retain audit logs for at least 365 days.
definition_of_done: Architecture reviewed against compliance controls; Integration tests confirm retention policies and immutability from application layer.
deployment_notes: May require specific database configuration (e.g., write-only user permissions).
business_value: Meets key compliance requirements for enterprise customers.

title: Backend: Implement Prometheus Metrics Endpoint
description: The transformation engine shall expose key performance and health metrics via a Prometheus-compatible `/metrics` endpoint.
sprint_goal: Implement production-readiness features: auditing, monitoring, and reliability.
acceptance_criteria: Accessing the `/metrics` endpoint returns data in a Prometheus-compatible text format. The endpoint exposes a metric for script execution time, memory usage, and counters for total executions, timeouts, and errors.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Integration tests verify that executing scripts updates the metrics on the `/metrics` endpoint.
business_value: Enables proactive monitoring, alerting, and performance analysis of the transformation feature.

title: Backend: Implement Job Isolation for Script Execution
description: The execution of a transformation script must be fully isolated, such that any unhandled exception or crash within the Jint engine is caught, logged, and results in the specific job being marked as 'Failed' without impacting the main application service or other jobs.
sprint_goal: Implement production-readiness features: auditing, monitoring, and reliability.
acceptance_criteria: Executing a script that causes an internal Jint engine error (e.g., stack overflow) does not crash the main .NET service. When such a crash occurs, the specific report generation job is updated to a 'Failed' status.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Integration test with a script that causes an engine-level crash confirms service stability and correct job failure marking.
business_value: Ensures high reliability of the main application service.

title: QA: Create and Integrate Performance Benchmark Test
description: The transformation engine must process a 10MB JSON dataset with a 200-statement benchmark script in under 10 seconds on standard server hardware, and this benchmark must be included in the QA test suite.
sprint_goal: Implement production-readiness features: auditing, monitoring, and reliability.
acceptance_criteria: A performance test exists in the QA test suite. The test uses a JSON input file of approximately 10MB. The test fails if the execution time on the defined standard hardware exceeds 10 seconds.
definition_of_done: Test code reviewed; Test integrated into CI/CD pipeline to run on a dedicated performance runner.
business_value: Provides a regression gate for performance and validates NFRs.

title: Implement System-Wide Feature Flag for Data Transformation
description: The Data Transformation feature shall be controlled by a system-wide feature flag to enable a phased rollout, starting with a 30-day internal pilot.
sprint_goal: Finalize documentation and prepare for a safe, controlled production rollout.
acceptance_criteria: A feature flag exists in the application configuration that can enable or disable the entire Data Transformation feature set. When the flag is disabled, all related UI elements are hidden and API endpoints are inaccessible.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; E2E tests validate both enabled and disabled states.
business_value: Reduces deployment risk and allows for a controlled rollout.

title: Documentation: Create Production Cutover and Rollback Plan
description: A production cutover plan must be created, defining go/no-go criteria and a documented rollback procedure.
sprint_goal: Finalize documentation and prepare for a safe, controlled production rollout.
acceptance_criteria: A formal cutover plan document exists. The plan includes explicit go/no-go criteria. The plan includes a step-by-step rollback procedure using the feature flag.
definition_of_done: Document reviewed and approved by engineering lead.
business_value: Ensures a safe and reversible production deployment.

title: Documentation: Create Comprehensive Feature Documentation
description: The system shall include comprehensive documentation for the data transformation feature, including a user guide, a technical API reference, and an OpenAPI 3.0 specification.
sprint_goal: Finalize documentation and prepare for a safe, controlled production rollout.
acceptance_criteria: A user guide exists that covers creating, managing, and testing scripts. An OpenAPI 3.0 specification file is available and accurately describes all transformation-related API endpoints.
definition_of_done: All documentation artifacts are peer-reviewed and published.
business_value: Empowers users and reduces support load.

title: Documentation: Update Backup and Recovery Procedures
description: All transformation scripts and their version history must be included in standard database backup and recovery procedures, with a Recovery Point Objective (RPO) of 1 hour and a Recovery Time Objective (RTO) of 4 hours.
sprint_goal: Finalize documentation and prepare for a safe, controlled production rollout.
acceptance_criteria: The database backup procedure is documented and includes the tables related to transformation scripts. A disaster recovery test demonstrates that scripts can be restored from a backup.
definition_of_done: Document reviewed and approved.
business_value: Ensures data durability for customer configurations.
